tool.name: ClosestBed
tool.description: find the closest, potentially non-overlapping interval
tool.command: closestBed $strand $addition #if $addition2.addition2_select: -D $addition2.addition2_select $addition2.iu $addition2.id #end if $io -mdb $mdb -t $ties #if str($k): -k $k #end if -a '$inputA' #if str($overlap_with.source) == "data_table": -b '$overlap_with.table.fields.path' #else #set inputBs = "' '".join([str( $file ) for $file in $overlap_with.inputB]) -b '$inputBs' #end if > '$output'

param.name: source
param.label: Overlap with: will you select a BED/VCF/GFF file from your history or use a built-in GFF file?
param.help: Built-in GFF files contain full annotation of a reference genome
param.option: Use a BED/VCF/GFF file from the history

param.name: table
param.label: Select reference GFF
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact the Galaxy team

param.name: ties
param.label: How ties for closest feature should be handled
param.help: This occurs when two features in B have exactly the same overlap with a feature in A.
param.option: first - Report the first tie that occurred in the B file
last - Report the last tie that occurred in the B file

param.name: addition
param.label: In addition to the closest feature in B, report its distance to A as an extra column
param.help: The reported distance for overlapping features will be 0

param.name: addition2_select
param.label: Add additional columns to report distance to upstream feature. Distance defintion
param.help: Like -d, report the closest feature in B, and its distance to A as an extra column. However unlike -d, use negative distances to report upstream features
param.option: Do not report the distance et all.
Report distance with respect to the reference genome. B features with a lower (start, stop) are upstream. (-ref)
Report distance with respect to A. When A is on the - strand, "upstream" means B has a higher (start,stop). (-a)
Report distance with respect to B. When B is on the - strand, "upstream" means A has a higher (start,stop). (-b)

param.label: Ignore features in B that overlap A
param.help: That is, we want close, yet not touching features only

param.label: How multiple databases are resolved
param.option: Report closest records for each database. (-each)
Report closest records among all databases. (-all)

tool.help:
**What it does**
Similar to intersectBed, closestBed searches for overlapping features in A and B. In the event that no feature in B overlaps the current feature in A, closestBed will report the closest (that is, least genomic distance from the start or end of A) feature in B. For example, one might want to find which is the closest gene to a significant GWAS polymorphism. Note that closestBed will report an overlapping feature as the closestâ€”that is, it does not restrict to closest non-overlapping feature.
